intro: Centropogon glaucotomentosus var. correanus, commonly known as the Correan grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, and it blooms during the summer months. This species is adapted to dry, open habitats and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
